meanings.definition: To give a title or name to something.
meanings.sent2: The librarian intituled the new book in the system.
meanings.sent3: The cat intituled itself 'King of the House'.
meanings.sent4: The champion intituled the trophy as his own.
meanings.sent5: The teacher intituled the project 'Creative Expressions'.

meanings.definition: To entitle or designate something as.
meanings.sent1: He intituled himself as the leader of the group.
meanings.sent2: The certificate intituled her as the winner.
meanings.sent3: The dog intituled the bone as his special treasure.
meanings.sent4: The ring intituled her as his beloved.
meanings.sent5: The badge intituled him as a VIP guest.

meanings.sent1: They intituled the plant with a scientific name.
meanings.sent2: The company intituled the product with a catchy brand.
meanings.sent3: The child intituled the toy as 'Mr. Fluffy'.
meanings.sent4: The chef intituled the dish 'Gourmet Delight'.
